title: Cape Cod National Seashore: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           99 Marconi Site Road  Wellfleet, MA 02667                 Directions         The national seashore is located in eastern Massachusetts and is accessed via Rt. 6. The park is 20 miles east of Hyannis, MA.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Cape Cod National Seashore Beaches, parking areas, and trails are open year-round between 6 AM and midnight. Salt Pond Visitor Center is open year-round from 9 AM to 4:30 PM. Province Lands Visitor Center is open seasonally from 9 AM to 5 PM. Park headquarters is open weekdays year-round.   Standard Hours    Sunday: 6:00 PM - 12:00 AM   Monday: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Thursday: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Friday: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Saturday: 6:00 AM - 12:00 AM             Weather           Cape Cod's weather is generally moderated by its proximity to the ocean. Winter is typically cold with some snow. Spring is often rainy. Summer is usually warm and humid. Fall is generally dry and clear.          Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Beaches - $20.00 Fees are collected at six beaches from late spring through Labor Day.  Daily fees: vehicles, $20; motorcycles, $10; walk-in, $3. Annual national seashore pass is $60.   Entrance Passes:   Annual Entrance Pass to Cape Cod National Seashore - $60.00 Pass entitles free entry into the six national seashore beaches for the season. The pass is assigned to a single vehicle, and may not be transferred to another vehicle.    Daily Entrance Fee for Cape Cod National Seashore - $20.00 Pass provides entrance into six beaches for one day. Multiple beaches managed by the national seashore can be visited in one day using the same pass. Passes may not be transferred to other vehicles.          Visitor Centers       Salt Pond Visitor Center The visitor center is open year-round with staff to help with trip planning; a well-stocked book and gift store; a museum focused on the Outer Cape's rich human stories; films; ranger programs; and views of the Nauset Marsh and Atlantic Ocean.   Province Lands Visitor Center Located at the tip of Cape Cod, this visitor center is perched atop a high dune with stunning views of the outer beach, Atlantic, and Provincetown. It's open spring through fall. The center includes a book and gift store, exhibits, and regular showings of park films.                 Red Maple Swamp Trail   Things to know in planning a visit: Look to the navigation on the left to find information useful in planning a visit to Cape Cod National Seashore. We also have some special guidance. Guidelines for public access to sensitive sites in Cape Cod National Seashore Special Events and Campfires at Cape Cod National Seashore  Water Bottle Filling Stations: When you refill a reusable water bottle,you decrease the greenhouse gas emissions associated with the production, filling, packaging and transport of disposable water containers. Designated water bottle filling stations have been installed in high public use areas of the park, making it easy to refill your water bottle. Filling stations are located: ·Inside Salt Pond Visitor Center ·Inside Province Lands Visitor Center ·Outside Herring Cove Beach Bathhouse Coming Soon: ·Outside Salt Pond Visitor Center Restroom Building ·Outside Coast Guard Beach Bathhouse ·Inside Highland Light Keeper's House bookstore In just two seasons, our Province Lands Visitor Center filling station helped eliminate over 35,000 disposable plastic bottle waste. Help us make a difference! Closures: Sections of the boardwalk at the Red Maple Swamp Trail have been closed due to structural deterioration and safety concerns. Check at Salt Pond Visitor Center for the current status of this trail, and for your safety, remain out of closed areas.
